alert.note: Alert for Clay (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 08 at 8:23PM CST until February 09 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Illinois, including the following counties, Clay, Crawford, Jasper, Lawrence and Richland. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall up to three quarters of an inch has already fallen in southeastern Illinois, and additional rainfall amounts of an inch or more are possible overnight. Locally over 2 inch amounts are possible by morning. - See flood safety information at http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
